content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Iron Plate Production Line (Position x=0.0-4.0, y=0.0)
Consists of two stone furnaces working on iron ore:
- Furnace 1 at (0.0, 0.0) with coal fuel and iron ore processing
- Furnace 2 at (2.0, 0.0) with coal fuel and iron ore processing

###Copper Plate Production (Position x=4.0, y=4.0)
Single stone furnace for copper plate production:
- Furnace at (4.0, 4.0) with coal fuel

###Iron Gear Wheel Assembly Line (Position x=6.5-12.5, y=11.5)
Automated assembly line consisting of:
- Input wooden chest at (6.5, 11.5) storing iron plates
- Burner inserter at (7.5, 11.5) moving items from input chest to assembler
- Assembling machine at (9.5, 11.5) crafting iron gear wheels
- Burner inserter at (11.5, 11.5) moving products to output chest
- Output wooden chest at (12.5, 11.5) storing produced iron gear wheels

###Power Generation System (Position x=-9.5 to -2.5, y=22.5-24.5)
Complete power setup consisting of:
- Offshore pump at (-9.5, 24.5) providing water
- Pipe network connecting water flow
- Boiler at (-7.0, 24.5) converting water to steam
- Steam engine at (-2.5, 24.5) generating electricity
- Electric pole network distributing power

###Research Lab Setup
Lab connected to power grid, currently researching logistics technology with automation science packs

ERROR TIPS

### Errors when trying to access non-existent entities
- Verify entity exists at the target position before trying to access it
- Double check coordinates when trying to find or place labs and other entities

### Errors when placing entities in occupied spaces
- Check if target position is clear before attempting to place new entities
- Ensure sufficient space around target position for larger entities

### Inventory related errors
- Verify required items are in inventory before attempting insertion operations
- Keep track of resource quantities to avoid running out of materials

### Research related errors
- Check if technology is already researched before attempting to research it again
- Verify research prerequisites are met before starting new research

### Variable reference errors
- Ensure all variables are properly defined before use
- Check for typos in variable names
